audio_caption: The audio clip starts with upbeat music that has a fantastical tone. A male speaker introduces a topic, referring to a "Grand Line Review" and saying they will be exploring "one of the most deadly fruits" in a series, wielded by a man who "spends most of his time on the toilet". There is a brief, cartoonish sound effect.

The clip starts with one male speaker discussing the properties of the "Doku Doku no Mi," a Paramecia-type fruit that allows the user to generate and manipulate poison. He clarifies that it's not a Logia-type fruit, emphasizing that the user cannot transform into poison, even though the character is known for covering himself in "death goo" which might give that impression. The tone is informative and analytical.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker discussing a fruit consumed by the warden of Impel Down. He believes the fruit's appearance was during the Impel Down arc. He describes the fruit's name as "straightforward," mentioning that "Doku" is the Japanese word for poison. He adds a fun fact, mentioning the onomatopoeia "Doku Doku" means "in a steady stream."

The clip begins with one male speaker discussing the agreement between Viz and Funimation regarding the English translation of a certain fruit. He points out that it's not "poison poison" but "venom venom fruit", explaining the difference between poison and venom. He acknowledges the slightly odd choice, referencing Magellan's techniques that use venom in their names and then noting many techniques also use the word poison. He ultimately concludes that "poison is what this fruit is really all about." The tone is conversational and informative.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing etymology and semantics, noting differences in translation choices regarding poison. His tone is explanatory and somewhat academic. He states he means it when he says one of the fruits is deadly.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing a fruit designed to cause harm, asserting that its effect is "up to the discretion of the user". His tone is informative and matter-of-fact. His speech is followed by some music.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing "poison typings," distinguishing between liquid and gas forms, and how users can control potency and mimic substances, mentioning an example of tear gas. His tone is informative and analytical.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker speculating about the "years over this fruit" and its ability to mimic poisons, if the user understands chemical compositions. He continues, discussing augmenting the fruit's output, and how the user could add a foreign agent to their body and wield "temporary poisonous glory." The speaker concludes this part by saying, "this sort of usage would be best suited to do a chemist, rather than, you know, a jailer."

The clip begins with a male speaker introducing the topic as an "examination" of a character's abilities, using a slightly excited tone. The speaker proceeds to describe the character, his tendencies and use of poison, explaining that he can cover himself in liquid poison as a sort of armor and can conjure hydras out of the same substance. A pause, then the speaker expresses enjoyment of the character's "venom road technique", describing the character's high-speed movement in the same excited tone.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing the "questionable use of fruit". He speaks in a calm, informative tone and says "consuming the doku doku no mi will make its user immune to the intended effects of external poisons". He emphasizes that it "does not negate the effects of foreign poisons entirely". He references Magellan's appetite and how he eats poisoned food, debunking the misconception that the food is poisoned through Magellan's own Devil Fruit powers. The speaker clarifies that Magellan sources outside poisons, leading to up to ten hours a day in the bathroom.

The audio features a male speaker who posits a terrifying idea: the awakening of a devil fruit. He references "the Doku Doku no Mi" and suggests that it might lead to apocalyptic devastation. The speaker then addresses a misconception about Magellan being an awakened Paramecia user, arguing that Magellan's ultimate attack, "the venom demon," doesn't necessarily indicate awakening, but is instead the result of toxins reacting with substances. He explains what an awakening would entail, in the style of other users, and clarifies that while Magellan might be awakened, he hasn't demonstrated standard signs. The audio does not include any music or background sounds.

The clip begins with calm speech by a male speaker discussing the "Doku Doku no Mi," considering its utility as a poison. He emphasizes its destructive tendency and questions how it can be applied to a peaceful existence, while suggesting other uses such as contributing to science. He also considers the possibility of using its powers for non-poisonous purposes. He acknowledges the power it holds, stating its potential for "combat and containment," before concluding and adding the fruit to the Devil Fruit encyclopedia. In the background, upbeat background music plays softly.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker, sounding conversational and upbeat, introducing a discussion about "floaty powers" and characters. Shortly after, upbeat and playful music starts, with instruments that sound like electronic keyboard and drums. The male speaker returns, with his voice slightly overlapping the music, to further elaborate the topic.

The clip begins with a male voice, with an energetic, almost excited tone, inviting listeners to "consider donating to the Grand Line Review Patreon" if they enjoy the video's content. He mentions his second channel, "New World Review", and encourages listeners to join his Discord server.  He signs off with, "This has been the Grand Line Review, and I'll see you next time." Following this, the clip ends with a brief, simple electronic musical piece.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker responding affirmatively to the question, if he has a dog. He confirms that he does, and if his dog had a Devil Fruit ability, he says that it would be related to licking, and names it the lick-lick fruit, which would enhance the user's tongue to the point where it has special powers. He continues to talk about how he thinks this because his dog is a voracious licker, and how when they first got him, his wife said it was just a phase, but now years later, if their faces are near the dog, they get an "instantaneous tongue bath".

The audio clip begins with a single male speaker, expressing intrigue about a hypothetical battle. He states that "Franky is not allowed to use his giant robot," and proceeds to consider the potential outcome. His speaking tone is thoughtful and conversational. As he continues, he contemplates the goals of each opponent, focusing on Brook's fixation with panties. He then declares Brook the winner, because Franky's underwear is always on display. The clip concludes as the speaker abruptly asks how long something took.

The audio clip begins with a singular male speaker discussing how his YouTube channel grew. He talks about how he needed an entire year to start gaining traction, reaching 500 subscribers by the end of the first year, after which things just exploded. He follows with mentioning doubling subscribers to 1000 after a month. The male speaker then addresses the question of why he doesn't make ten-minute videos. He explained that he hasn't received legitimate sponsorship offers, only dodgy ones. He then states that his goal is to deliver clear, concise, and easily digestible content, so he just hates padding his videos.
